UserCode.Behaviours
Interface IBehaviour

All Known Implementing Classes:
Behaviour, Bubble, FishFood, JavaBubbler, JavaFish, JavaSeaHorse, JavaUrchin, Piranha
public interface IBehaviour

IBehaviour Interface defines the behaviours for all pets within the aquarium simulation and the helper methods they have access to

Version:
3.0
Author:
Chris Williams

Method Detail

addComponent

void addComponent(IComponent _component)
METHOD: to be used to add new IComponents to the _components HashMap.

Parameters:
_component - the new component to add

generateSpeed

void generateSpeed()
METHOD: Generate a random speed to assign to a _speed field, should be between 0.005 and 0.05

generateSpeed

void generateSpeed(String s)
Overloaded method METHOD: Generate a random speed which will be either fast or slow. Fast is between - 0.05 & 0.0225, Slow is between 0.010 & 0.005

Parameters:
s - a String, either "fast" or "slow" to generate a random number

getIComponent

IComponent getIComponent(String _name)
METHOD: used to get a specific IComponent within an IComponent's HashMap. This method will return the HashMap value which is the IComponent

Parameters:
_name - the 'key' String name of the component
Returns:
IComponent the IComponent requested, if not found null will be returned

getOrientation

double[] getOrientation()
GETTER METHOD: GETTER to retrieve the orientation of the pet

Returns:
double[] returns the value of the orientations as an array of doubles

getPosition

double[] getPosition()
GETTER METHOD: Return the X Y and Z fields held in IToken

Returns:
an array of doubles {x,y,z}

getScale

double getScale()
GETTER METHOD: Get the scale of the pet in the aquarium

Returns:
a value of type double representing the scale

getSpeed

double getSpeed()
GETTER METHOD: Get the value held within the _speed field

Returns:
double returns the field _speed to caller

Initialise

void Initialise(List<IComponent> _components)
ABSTRACT METHOD: Used to set-up any properties and components the class requires

Parameters:
an - arrayList of IComponents the IBehaviour concrete class requires

randomScale

void randomScale()
SETTER METHOD: Set the scale of the pet in the aquarium to a random value

setOrientation

void setOrientation(double _oriX,
                    double _oriY)
SETTER METHOD: Set a new Orientation of the pet on the x and y axis.

Parameters:
_oriX - a double for the x Orientation
_oriY - a double for the y Orientation

setOrientation

void setOrientation(double _oriX,
                    double _oriY,
                    double _oriZ)
METHOD: Set a new Orientation of the pet on all axis

Parameters:
_oriX - the new X orientation
_oriY - the new Y orientation
_oriZ - the new Z orientation

setPosition

void setPosition(double newX,
                 double newY)
SETTER METHOD: Set a new position of the pet within the aquarium on the X and Y axis

Parameters:
newX - the new X position
newY - the new Y position

setPosition

void setPosition(double newX,
                 double newY,
                 double newZ)
OVERLOADED SETTER METHOD: set the position of the pet on the x and y and z axis, method updates the IToken with the new values.

Parameters:
newX - the x position
newY - the y position
newZ - the z position

setScale

void setScale(double s)
SETTER METHOD: Set the scale of the pet in the aquarium

Parameters:
s - a double representing the scale of the pet

setStartPosition

void setStartPosition(String _placement)
METHOD: Place the pet at a random position based on the param. Method randomises x & y position

Parameters:
_placement - of type string representing the general position to set the y coord ("top", "bottom")

Terminate

void Terminate()
METHOD: Used to clean up any threads or active components that need shutting down

update

void update()
ABSTRACT METHOD: Used to update the pets specific properties based on the IComponents and the main method called by the Entity Manager
